experience: You and Tyler both know Matt Greene, Monte Cahn, and 112 others

Noteworthy Accomplishments:•	Spearheaded a database migration project, simplifying the architecture while removing single points of failure.  Introduced an architectural strategy that saved hundreds of thousands in licensing costs for the company.•	Assisted InfoSec team in moving to a new security platform on each system, both Windows and Linux.  Wrote a PowerShell script from scratch to automate the deployment of the new security software, saving weeks in employee time.•	Spearheaded the migration of our backup platform.  Architected and build the platform per vendor specifications and recommendations, yielding a 20-fold increase in backup/restore performance on the physical systems, virtual machines, and databases.  Created automated tasks via scripts to perform weekly test restores on each backup environment, which in turn automatically send email reports for validation of good backups.•	Was assigned a project that involved standing up 16 systems and configure a vendor application within a 1-week period.  Through the use of PowerShell scripts and other means of automation, I was able to build the environment with the required software in 2 days, beating expectations.•	Assigned a project to migrate a reporting platform from old physical systems to our virtual environment.  Working closely with the application vendor, we successfully migrated the data and infrastructure.  However, the owner of the platform (a manager) was spending hours every single morning manually cleaning up old reports from the platform as he had done for years.  After doing some research on the platform, I was able to create a script which performed the cleanup operation automatically, saving thousands of dollars in employee time.
3060 N Litchfield RD, Suite 120, Goodyear AZ 85338

Noteworthy Accomplishments:•	Took initiative to build out an internal MS Exchange availability group, removing single points of failure and increasing email uptime 10-fold.  This was done by creating a 3 site architecture, keeping our communication and ticketing system up at all times.•	Spearheaded dozens of individual projects for small companies, by either fixing, rebuilding, or creating a brand new architecture for each client.  Responded personally to any concerns of each client, working closely with the leadership teams.•	Built and maintained a backup platform for each client, utilizing automated restore testing with email reports.  This gave each client peace of mind knowing that their invaluable data was safe both locally and in the cloud.•	Worked on and closed thousands of support tickets, outperforming any other employee 3-fold.  This lead to a high level of customer satisfaction.
2255 West Northern Avenue B100, Phoenix, AZ 85021

Responsible for maintaining servers, and for supporting end users (approximately 150 employees):•	Check work order system for entries on server and server resource issues.•	Support end users with Desktop Computers, Laptop Computers, Mobile Devices, and peripherals.•	Prioritize and respond to work orders as appropriate.•	Ad and delete users in Active Directory.•	Setting up and managing accounts in Microsoft Exchange. •	Ad and modify ACL’s for shared recourses.•	Perform nightly backups of VMware VSphere images.•	Perform maintenance and updates to company website.

Responsible for meeting client objectives for all types of computer services to include diagnosing and analyzing computer issues for both hardware and software. Plan, schedule and prioritize each day’s activities to include business development, accounting, advertising, web development and maintenance.Installation of new computers, hardware and peripherals.Reconfigure existing systems to accommodate additional components.Troubleshoot all areas of computer functioning, repair or upgrade as needed.Skilled at protecting computers from cyber threats and other security issues.Configuring Local Area Networks.Configuring Windows Server 2008 R2, Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange.

I've worked with Tyler for a little over a year now.  He is Climate Pro's Sr IT Engineer at AZ Tech Works.  Tyler is incredibly and abundantly skilled in the vast areas of the technology industry.  We haven't been able to stump him with our tech needs here at Climate Pro.  He's got script and cmd syntax memorized and ready to execute haha.  We had an issue that went months without resolve with our prior tech company, and Tyler had it resolved within his first 5 minutes of being onsite at Climate Pro for the first time; talk about making a great first impression!  His abilities exuberate confidence and continuously produce the best solution quickly and efficiently.  Tyler executes and strategically plans with superiority and with his client's interests and needs as priority one.  Organized is another word that would accurately describe Tyler; he's got that down too!  No ticket, big or small, goes unanswered, forgotten, or pushed aside.  Tyler always acts and performs out of best practice.  In addition, and importantly, Tyler never geek speaks my team and is able to quickly establish one's level of knowledge to elect best language to be spoken.  Ultimately, as the Sr IT Technician at AZ Tech Works, Tyler's team truly serve proof as to what kind of leader he is, as their actions, demeanor, and results are a direct and measurable outcome and reflection of his leadership!

summary: Highly personable Systems Engineer with experience in computerhardware/software, and Windows Server technologies, including Active Directory, MSExchange, Lync, SQL, IIS, and Office365.  Also versed in network technologies, including Routing, Switching, VLAN's, and network security.  Extremely focused and results-oriented in supporting complex operations, able to identify goals and priorities and resolve issues in initial stages.
